DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numerical value that represents the three dimensional space occupied by the spleen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach.

Concepts.definition: An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.

Property.preferredDefinition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

Concepts.definition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a value representing the calculated three-dimensional size or capacity of an organ in the human body as determined by surgical or pathological measure or by a diagnostic imaging procedure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.
